explanation: Agent A's report is not correct. The (void)lfs; in lfs_file_tell_ is the common, intentional idiom to mark a parameter as intentionally unused and to suppress compiler warnings. MISRA C Rule 2.2 targets executed operations whose removal would not affect the program behaviour; although removing the cast-to-void would not alter the runtime behaviour of the program, its purpose is to communicate intent and control diagnostics. In practice MISRA guidance treats such explicit void-casts as a legitimate way to indicate an unused parameter (and many MISRA analyses do not treat them as ‘dead code’). Also note the cast appears in lfs_file_tell_, not in the lfs_file_tell wrapper shown earlier. Therefore the claim of a Rule 2.2 violation is incorrect.
